alert.note: Alert for Brown; Dickinson; Geary; Jackson; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 10:56PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dickinson, Geary, southern Riley, northwestern Wabaunsee, Pottawatomie, Nemaha, northwestern Jackson, southern Brown and southeastern Marshall Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1055 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Fairview to 9 miles northwest of Volland. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manhattan, Junction City, Abilene, Wamego, Hiawatha, Seneca, Alma, Westmoreland, Blaine, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, Chapman, Onaga, St. George, Milford, Centralia, Wetmore, Fairview, McFarland and Olsburg. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 276 and 330. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Dickinson; Geary; Jackson; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Riley; Wabaunsee
